questiontext.text:
Exercise

Calculate the area enclosed by the curve \(y=x^3\) and the line \(y=x\). [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

generalfeedback.text:
The curve \(y=x^3\) and the line \(y=x\) intersect at \(x=-1,0,1\). Between 0 and 1 the graph is above the \(x\) axis and \(y=x\) is greater than \(y=x^3\). Between -1 and 0, the graph is below the \(x\) axis and \(y=x^3\) is greater than \(y=x\). Hence the area is \[- \int_{-1}^0 (x^3 -x) \,\mathrm{d}x + \int_0^1 (x-x^3) \, \mathrm{d}x = {@ta4@}\]
